docblock.description:
A comprehensive library for generating differences between two strings in multiple formats (unified, side by side HTML etc)
PHP version 5
Copyright (c) 2009 Chris Boulton <chris.boulton@interspire.com>
All rights reserved.

var.description: The "old" sequence to use as the basis for the comparison.
The "new" sequence to generate the changes for.
Array containing the generated opcodes for the differences between the two items.
Associative array of the default options available for the diff class and their default value.
Array of the options that have been applied for generating the diff.

param.description: Array containing the lines of the first string to compare.
Array containing the lines for the second string to compare.

description.compact: Render a diff using the supplied rendering class and return it.

param.description: An instance of the rendering object to use for generating the diff.

return.description: The generated diff. Exact return value depends on the rendered.

description.compact: Get a range of lines from $start to $end from the first comparison string and return them as an array. If no values are supplied, the entire string is returned. It's also possible to specify just one line to return only that line.

param.description: The ending number. If not supplied, only the item in $start will be returned.

return.description: Array of all of the lines between the specified range.

description.compact: Get a range of lines from $start to $end from the second comparison string and return them as an array. If no values are supplied, the entire string is returned. It's also possible to specify just one line to return only that line.

param.description: The ending number. If not supplied, only the item in $start will be returned.

return.description: Array of all of the lines between the specified range.

description.compact: Generate a list of the compiled and grouped opcodes for the differences between the two strings. Generally called by the renderer, this class instantiates the sequence matcher and performs the actual diff generation and return an array of the opcodes for it. Once generated, the results are cached in the diff class instance.

return.description: Array of the grouped opcodes for the generated diff.
